Core Flight Executive Documentation » cFE Deployment Guide » How to Configure, Build, and Run the cFE » Load and Run the cFE Core and cFE Applications

Start the cFE Core on the Target

With everything loaded, the cFE can be started. Starting the cFE is a highly target dependant activity. The following table gives examples of how to start the cFE on various platforms. For full details see the notes for each section.

How to start the cFE on Various Target Systems:

"Target" operating system How to start the cFE
RTEMS Loaded through GDB/BDM using a shell script:
"debug.sh"
vxWorks 6.2 / RAD750 Started from the vxWorks Target Shell command:
startCfeCore "/eep:0/cfe-core.o"
Linux Start directly from the linux shell:
$ ./core-linux.bin PO 1
All of the command line options can be listed by typing:
$./core-linux.bin -h
Mac OS X Start directly from the OS X shell:
$ ./core-osx.bin PO 1
All of the command line options can be listed by typing:
$./core-osx.bin -h
Windows/Cygwin Start directly from the Cygwin shell:
$ ./core-cygwin.exe PO 1
All of the command line options can be listed by typing:
$./core-cygwin.exe -h
